page.title: 10LOCAL NEWS
page.content: At the moment the local newspaper and radio are busy reporting on the {'STORMY BANK'}issue.Stormy Bank lies 16 miles off the island of{HOY.}The Government are drilling test holes in the sea-bed to see if it is suitable for nuclear waste dumping.If it is, European waste will be dumped off Orkney.Most Orcadians disagree with the dumping and have formed a group to protest about this. The main worry is that the cannisters will leak and pollute the sea and land.This may eventually kill off many fish, animals, birds and plants. The campaign has started with leaflets being circulated explaining the situation to the local people.
